Startup India, DPIIT has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Maruti Suzuki India Limited to strengthen innovation and support emerging enterprises in the automotive domain.

As part of the partnership, Maruti Suzuki will:

‚ú¶ Collaborate with DPIIT-recognised startups working on EV charging infrastructure, battery swapping, rental models, and smart grid integration.
‚ú¶ Offer startups access to the Maruti Suzuki Accelerator Programme to enable access to mentorship, PoCs, and scope for long-term collaboration.
‚ú¶ Participate in the Bharat Startup Grand Challenge, supporting procurement-linked opportunities for standout solutions.
‚ú¶ Provide on-ground exposure to cutting-edge manufacturing facilities in Kharkhoda, Haryana, leveraging AI technologies and empowering grassroots startups.
‚ú¶ Connect startups with its Incubator network for early-stage support and co-development.
‚ú¶ Guide startups on aligning their innovations with Maruti Suzuki‚Äôs supply chain through targeted mentorship.

The initiative showcases a symbiotic public-private partnership, driving innovation and empowering startups nationwide

üÜïA promising nano-robot technology to manage tooth hypersensitivity and ease root canals! A CCAMP startup, Theranautilus has made a unique nanomaterial- a Calcium-based colloidal gel, called the CalBots, which by the force of magnetic field, navigates through the micropores of complex dental topography and self-assembles to form a biocompatible seal that prevents the dental hypersentivity.

This regenerative magnetic bioglass-based nanomaterial penetrates more than 300¬†¬µm deep inside the dentine tissue to re-form new tooth structure, thereby healing the dentine tubules, which are otherwise exposed during tooth hypersentivity

This is the first time that such a targeted on-site dental issue management has been created as the nano material based gel is delivered by nano robots deep into the tissue to fix the problem. Existing solutions reside on toothpastes or adhesive resins that are limited to the surface area management and/or provides short-term relief

Theranautilus is supported through the DBT BIRAC #BiotechIgnitionGrant programme at CCAMP 

Learn more about the tech here:
üîóhttps://lnkd.in/gk_Q2yKu

Picture credit: Figure 1 of the above publication

Taslimarif Saiyed, PhD, Department of Biotechnology, Ambarish Ghosh, India DST, IT BT Department, Karnataka, Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Advanced Portfolio, Wiley , Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC)

We are proud to be fostering several next gen deep-science based innovative solutions and research that are bridging critical gaps in healthcare, agriculture and environment

Some of these include
üß™Mitigating antimicrobial resistance, strengthening maternal and child health, treating degenerative illnesses and cancer, and developing diagnostics for infectious diseases,
üß™Replacing chemical pesticides with biologicals, boosting crop productivity and farmer incomes, and increasing food security

Prof. Ajay Sood, Principal Scientific Adviser to the Government of India, chaired the inaugural edition of the India AMR Innovation Workshop, hosted by CCAMP!

We are deeply grateful for his continued guidance and support.

‚ÄúC-CAMP is doing a wonderful job of putting so many things together - from fundamental science to innovation to production. This is truly the kind of synergy that will take us far,‚Äù he remarked.

The workshop was held under the aegis of the India AMR Innovation Hub (IAIH), a unique global convergence platform on AMR, chaired by Office of the Principal Scientific Adviser to the Government of India.

Prof. Sood also stressed the importance of #IAIH as an important initiative feeding into the upcoming Indian National Action Plan (NAP 2.0) on AMR.

Catch glimpses from the workshop now. 
More such conversations coming soon! Stay tuned!

#IndiaFightsAMR

üåü Congratulations to Deep Algorithms Solutions on raising ‚Çπ10.8 Cr (approx. $1.25M) in Seed Funding led by Unicorn India Ventures! üåü

We are proud to share that Deep Algorithms Solutions, one of our incubated portfolio startups at IIT Mandi Catalyst, has successfully raised ‚Çπ10.8 crore ($1.25 million) in a seed funding round led by Unicorn India Ventures, with participation from several esteemed angel investors.

Founded by J P Mishra in December 2021, Deep Algorithms Solutions is a pioneering behavioral cybersecurity and AI startup committed to tackling sophisticated cyber fraud. The startup leverages indigenous AI and behavioral intelligence to address critical challenges in digital identity security and real-time application protection.

This milestone funding reinforces confidence in their vision and the impactful problem they are solving ‚Äî Identity Security and Real-Time Application Security powered by AI and Behavioral Intelligence.

üí• More power to the team as they continue to innovate and protect the digital world!

NSRCEL in collaboration with HABITAT INDIA recently hosted "Climate Connect: Net-Zero Buildings and Green Data Centers", this roundtable conversation brought together voices from across the ecosystem investors, innovators, architects, developers, sustainability leads, and enablers driving real action towards net-zero infrastructure and data centers.
The discussion focused on the¬†real challenges of scaling green buildings and sustainable infrastructure from fragmented standards and financing gaps to material traceability and the need for region-specific solutions.

Key areas addressed during the roundtable included:
 üå± Creating a standardized framework for sustainable construction
 üìä Integrating sustainability metrics into core decision-making
 üß± Supporting climate tech startups with patient capital
 üìö Sharing open-source playbooks on materials and best practices
 üîå Rethinking data center sustainability beyond one-size-fits-all models
 ü§ù Building a collaborative, inclusive knowledge ecosystem

A key takeaway? 
The business problems cannot have policy solutions.

The roundtable closed with concrete next steps and commitments from stakeholders to drive forward real, scalable impact.

Akshatha Narayana Stuti Kakkar Ramneek Bhatia Sumeet Popli Mahesh Kanak Dhiraj Chilakapaty Aiyappa Somayanda Sriram Kuchimanchi
Sarah Jacob Kunjpreet Arora Samhita R Abhijit Paul Zacharia Dr. Sunita Purushottam Karthik Chandrasekar

üìä Thank You, Dr. Raghunandan NK! üí°

üôè We at DERBI Foundation extend our sincere appreciation to Dr. Raghunandan N K for conducting a high-impact workshop on the Business Model Canvas (BMC) for our startup cohort.

üï¥ The session offered deep insights into how startups can move beyond traditional business planning to embrace flexible, iterative, and value-driven models. 

ü™û From refining the value proposition and customer segmentation to mapping key metrics, pricing strategies, and leveraging unfair advantages, the workshop equipped our founders with practical tools to build, test, and evolve their models.

Key highlights included:
 ‚úÖ Understanding the BMC framework and its adaptability
 ‚úÖ The Build-Measure-Learn loop in validating startup assumptions
 ‚úÖ Identifying customer pain points and market demand
 ‚úÖ Real-life examples that grounded theory in startup reality

Thank you, Dr. Raghunandan, for empowering our startups with the clarity and structure needed to navigate their growth with confidence and strategy!

As India‚Äôs agriculture sector grapples with climate uncertainty, water stress, and rising input costs, the need for resilient, scalable innovations has never been more urgent.¬† 

Krishi Mangal, an initiative by Social Alpha and Cisco CSR, is looking for start-ups working to shape the future of agriculture. 

Now in its third edition, Krishi Mangal invites applications from start-ups developing affordable, scalable, and field-validated technologies that strengthen India‚Äôs agricultural resilience.¬† 

The program is open to innovations solving for Integrated Farming Management, Soil Rejuvenation and Irrigation Management, Farm Mechanisation, Post-Harvest Management, and Livestock Waste Management.¬† 

Applications close on 13th July 2025.¬†Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony

#FarmingForward #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture #FarmersDeserveDeepTech

India‚Äôs livestock sector is growing‚Äîbut so is the waste it generates. 

Inadequate waste management leads to methane emissions, groundwater contamination, and health risks for farm-adjacent and farming communities.¬†
At the same time, this waste stream holds untapped value‚Äîfrom clean energy to soil health to circular inputs for agriculture. 

We‚Äôre inviting start-ups using AI/ML and IoT in developing solutions that: 

- Transform livestock waste into biogas, biofertilisers, or organic inputs¬†
- Build decentralised, efficient processing systems¬†
- Reduce handling complexity and make adoption feasible for small farmers¬†
- Enable climate-positive, income-generating uses of dairy or poultry waste 

Solutions should be scalable, sustainable, and relevant to low-resource rural or peri-urban contexts. 

Selected start-ups will receive funding, lab and prototyping support, incubation, expert mentorship, and access to implementation and capital partners. 

Applications close on 13th July 2025.¬†Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony

#FarmingForward #LivestockWasteInnovation #CircularEconomy #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture

Drug testing is evolving, and so are the tools behind it. With the FDA Modernization Acts 2.0 and 3.0, regulators are opening the door to more advanced, human-relevant approaches to testing.

From bio-printed tissue models to organ-on-chip platforms and AI-powered simulations, today‚Äôs New Approach Methodologies (NAMs) are helping researchers develop safer, more precise treatments, while reducing dependence on animal models.

üö® Startup Tip No. 2: Validate before you build

Got an app idea? A new product in mind?

Pause.

Before building anything, talk to 50 people.
‚úì Understand their problems
‚úì Learn how they currently solve it
‚úì Ask if they'd pay for your solution

Your first milestone isn‚Äôt a prototype; it‚Äôs real conversations.

At VentureStudio, too many founders skip this step and build in the dark.

Validation saves you months of rework and regret.

Talk first. Build later.

#StartupTips #ValidateBeforeYouBuild #EarlyStageStartups #ProductValidation #CustomerDiscovery #VentureStudio #BuildSmart #StartupAdvice #FounderJourney

We‚Äôre proud to share that FaceIntel Technologies, an iCreate-supported startup, is making headlines for its impactful deployment in public safety during the Bonalu festival at the Mahakali Temple, Hyderabad.

Faced with 40,000‚Äì50,000 daily footfalls, the Telangana Police Department entrusted FaceIntel‚Äôs real-time crowd monitoring solution to ensure smooth flow and safety. Their AI-powered system is based on cutting-edge face-recognition technology that is scalable to 1000+ recognitions per minute with 98%+ accuracy. It tracks 'People In and Out' and instantly alerts the control room when thresholds are breached‚Äîpreventing stampede-like situations before they happen.

üëè The success of this deployment has been officially appreciated by the Commissioner of Police, Hyderabad‚Äîa proud milestone for FaceIntel Technologies and for all of us at iCreate!

Behind this impactful innovation are founders Rajesh kandlagunta and Dr Akhil Gurram, Ph.D., whose vision and tech-led approach are transforming public safety infrastructure.

This is innovation in action‚Äîwhere Deep Tech meets real-world problem-solving.
- Powered by: FaceIntel Technologies
- In collaboration with: Telangana Police Department
- Supported by: iCreate ‚Äì India‚Äôs leading startup incubator for tech innovation
